text: **Financial bookkeeping is complicated and time-consuming** by nature ([The Best Accounting Software for Small Businesses in 2025 | PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-small-business-accounting-software#:~:text=Financial%20bookkeeping%20is%20complicated%20and,the%20required%20tax%20payments%20on)), and many software packages overwhelm users with jargon and features meant for accountants.

Modern providers *have* tried to make interfaces as simple and pleasant as possible ([The Best Accounting Software for Small Businesses in 2025 | PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-small-business-accounting-software#:~:text=Accounting%20can%20be%20complicated%2C%20and,easiest%20accounting%20programs%20to%20use)), but many freelancers still find themselves drowning in what feels like spreadsheet hell.

Let‚Äôs break down that wish list, because it‚Äôs a tall order ‚Äì but not impossible ‚Äì and see which features are must-haves:

- **Simple Recurring Invoices & One-Click Billing:**

Many modern invoicing tools do offer recurring billing; for example, Zoho Books‚Äô free tier supports recurring invoices and even **automatic payment reminders** out of the box ([The Best Accounting Software for Small Businesses in 2025 | PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-small-business-accounting-software#:~:text=Zoho%20Books%20has%20a%20surprisingly,connections%20to%20your%20financial%20institutions)).
Chasing late payments is the worst, so the app should handle follow-ups for you.
The dream system would automatically nudge clients who are late ‚Äì possibly even with a bit of personality in the message (‚ÄúHi, just checking in **again** üôÇ‚Ä¶‚Äù).

Most invoicing apps today can send polite late payment reminders; for instance, FreshBooks and others let you enable emails to clients when an invoice is overdu ([Invoice and Accounting Software for Small Businesses - FreshBooks](https://www.freshbooks.com/#:~:text=Invoicing%20Create%20professional%20invoices%20in,accounting%20tools%2C%20powerful%20financial%20reports))„Äë.

* The perfect app would automatically recognize common business expenses ‚Äì if you spend a day working at a coffee shop, it should know that‚Äôs a business expense (and maybe even tag it as ‚ÄúMeals & Entertainment‚Äù or ‚ÄúWorkspace‚Äù appropriately).

Some solutions are already moving this direction: FreshBooks, for example, offers automated expense categorization when you import your bank or credit card dat ([Invoice and Accounting Software for Small Businesses - FreshBooks](https://www.freshbooks.com/#:~:text=Invoicing%20Create%20professional%20invoices%20in,accounting%20tools%2C%20powerful%20financial%20reports))„Äë.

**Real-time tax estimation** is actually a feature in some newer apps: the Found banking app automatically calculates your self-employment tax estimates as you earn and spen ([Found Review: New Banking For the Self-Employed 2025](https://wisdomdepot.com/found-review/#:~:text=Found%20Banking%20simplifies%20tax%20management,with%20features%20like))„Äë.
The dream app **must handle multiple currencies seamlessly**.
That means you should be able to invoice in EUR or GBP, get paid in those currencies, and then see it converted to your home currency (USD or CAD) with all the intermediary steps clear.

FreshBooks lets you create an invoice in, say, Euros, and will show you reports with both the original ‚Ç¨ amount and the converted value in your base currenc ([6+ Best Multi-currency Accounting Software [2025]](https://www.ecaplabs.com/blogs/multi-currency-accounting-software#:~:text=include%20multi,automatically%20applying%20current%20exchange%20rates))„Äë.
It should feel like a **calm control center** for your finances, not a maze of reports.
So the whole system *must* work great on a smartphone.

You‚Äôd like to send an invoice that has a built-in **‚ÄúPay Now‚Äù button** where the client can pay by credit card, ACH, PayPal, **right then and there**, without being shuttled off to some clunky third-party site that feels sketchy.

When you email an invoice from platforms like FreshBooks, Wave, or Zoho, you can include a link or button for the client to pay online via Stripe, PayPal, etc ([The Best Accounting Software for Small Businesses in 2025 | PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-small-business-accounting-software#:~:text=How%20Do%20Accounting%20Apps%20Handle,Completed%20Transactions))„Äë.

The dream system would perhaps even allow saving client payment info for recurring charges (with permission, of course) so that your retainer clients get auto-charged ‚Äì truly ‚Äúset it and forget it‚Äù for you.

In fact, Intuit (maker of QuickBooks) has announced **‚ÄúIntuit Assist,‚Äù an AI-powered financial assistant** that aims to give personalized recommendations and do some of the hard work for yo ([Intuit Assist - A new generative AI-powered financial assistant | Intuit](https://www.intuit.com/intuitassist/#:~:text=Intuit%20Assist))„Äë.

FreshBooks especially shines in simplicity ‚Äì it‚Äôs frequently cited as being *one of the easiest accounting programs to use ([The Best Accounting Software for Small Businesses in 2025 | PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-small-business-accounting-software#:~:text=Accounting%20can%20be%20complicated%2C%20and,easiest%20accounting%20programs%20to%20use))„Äë, and it avoids heavy accounting jargon, which is a relief to many.

FreshBooks **does support multi-currency invoices and expenses**, though only on its higher-tier plan ([6+ Best Multi-currency Accounting Software [2025]](https://www.ecaplabs.com/blogs/multi-currency-accounting-software#:~:text=FreshBooks%2C%20while%20primarily%20known%20for,automatically%20applying%20current%20exchange%20rates))
It will automatically handle currency conversions at current exchange rates.

On the expense side, it connects to your bank to import transactions and uses **automated categorization** to sort expenses for yo ([Invoice and Accounting Software for Small Businesses - FreshBooks](https://www.freshbooks.com/#:~:text=Invoicing%20Create%20professional%20invoices%20in,accounting%20tools%2C%20powerful%20financial%20reports))„Äë

You can invoice in dozens of currencies, and when you record payment, Wave will calculate the conversion to your home currency.

Intuit has tried to address ease-of-use (‚Äúthe software is easy enough to learn if you‚Äôre inexperienced,‚Äù notes one revie ([The Best Accounting Software for Small Businesses in 2025 | PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-small-business-accounting-software#:~:text=Who%20It%27s%20For))„Äë), but compared to FreshBooks or Wave, it‚Äôs still more **heavy-duty**.

Also, many of the cooler features (like multi-currency) are locked behind higher-priced plans ‚Äì QuickBooks Online‚Äôs ‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù plan (needed for multi-currency) can run around $200+ a mont ([6+ Best Multi-currency Accounting Software [2025]](https://www.ecaplabs.com/blogs/multi-currency-accounting-software#:~:text=Pricing%3A%20QuickBooks%20Online%20Advanced%20starts,at%20%24235%20per%20month))„Äë, which is overkill for a freelancer.
